title: Sunflower Sclerotinia head rot surveys and forecasting
text:
Key questions

How frequent and severe is Sclerotinia head rot across regions and seasons?

Which weather and management variables are associated with increased risk?

Where and how might forecasting add value for producers?

title: Contact us and work with us
text:
Work with us

We welcome collaboration across research, industry and producer organisations. Typical collaboration formats include:

Field trials and disease monitoring

Disease diagnostics and surveys

Modelling and forecasting tool development

Co-developed extension materials and training events

To explore collaboration, email a short description of your idea, crop, region and timelines to your.email@ufs.ac.za.

title: Contact us and work with us
text:
Student opportunities

From time to time we host honours, MSc and PhD projects in field pathology and epidemiology.
If you are interested in joining the group, send:

A brief CV

Academic transcripts

A short paragraph on why you are interested in field pathology and epidemiology

to your.email@ufs.ac.za.

title: Background, Vision and Mission
text:
Vision

To provide robust, field-based epidemiological insights that support sustainable disease management and resilient farming systems in Southern Africa.

(Adjust the wording to your own.)

title: Background, Vision and Mission
text:
Mission

Generate high-quality field data and epidemiological analyses

Translate research into actionable guidance for producers and advisors

Build and maintain national and international collaborations

Train and mentor students in field pathology, epidemiology and science communication

title: Background, Vision and Mission
text:
Values

Research quality and integrity

Service to producers and industry

Collegiality and student development

Openness to collaboration and innovation

title: McLab Field Pathology & Epidemiology Group
text: Epidemiology and field pathology as a bridge between plant pathologists, industry and farmers, delivering actionable insights and cultivating the next generation of researchers.

title: McLab Field Pathology & Epidemiology Group
text:
About us
The McLab Field Pathology & Epidemiology Group focuses on plant disease epidemiology, field pathology and disease management within South African cropping systems. We work at the interface of field trials, diagnostics, modelling and producer-focused extension.
Read more about our background, vision and mission »

title: McLab Field Pathology & Epidemiology Group
text:
What we do

Field pathology and epidemiology across major crops and regions

Disease forecasting and modelling to support timely management decisions

Producer-focused extension and training, grounded in research

Student development, supervision and mentoring in field pathology

title: Projects
text:
Our projects span field trials, diagnostics, modelling and producer extension across multiple crops. Use the filters to view Current or Completed projects.


    
      
      
    










Sunflower Sclerotinia head rot surveys and forecasting



Current



National survey and modelling work on Sclerotinia head rot intensity, distribution and management in South African sunflower production.

title: McLab renovation and lab opening
text:
We opened the renovated McLab space with a small event, coffee and doughnuts, and a walkthrough of the new workflow for field sample processing.
This marks the start of a new phase for our field pathology and epidemiology work at UFS.
